The claim originated from an entertainme: which published an article about a zoo in China naming a baby gorilla Harambe McHarambeface.
The Jinhua Zoo: located in China's Zhejiang province, allegedly held an online naming contest for the baby gorilla, with "Harambe McHarambeface" winning over 93% of the votes.
The Boston Leader article was found to b: as there was no evidence of the Jinhua Zoo naming a baby gorilla Harambe McHarambeface. The Boston Leader website itself was also relatively new, starting just a day before the article was published.
There was no record of any Jinhua Zoo of: nor any mention of the alleged Chinese name "Heijin" associated with the gorilla.
